author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
If the purpose of this fork is just for personal use, I would say that it's not necessary that it be registered.

Hello,

I was thinking the same thing. The problem lies with we are using Pluto and this package requires instruments to be added to a YAML file (along with us adding other instruments not defined). But Pluto creates its own environment and wont pull from a YAML in the working directory (I have tried using InstrumentConfig). I can deactivate this environment but it defeats the purpose of being able to share Pluto notebooks easily to others.

If you have any suggestions I'm more than welcome to them. (Also the code will follow a similar path to theirs so we will be adding instruments and their functions that theoretically someone else can use.)

Best,
Charles
________________________________

Subject: Re: [JuliaRegistries/General] New package: TcpControl v0.1.0 (PR #61348)

If the purpose of this fork is just for personal use, I would say that it's not necessary that it be registered.

â€”
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/61348#issuecomment-1141485145>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AVKGZHCZNJYAL2AIPQVFXKTVMUW3JANCNFSM5XLQM5ZQ>.
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***>

Thanks for the explanation. I think that this is a bug that will need to be fixed in Pluto. It's not really sustainable or scalable for each user to register a package in the General registry just to work around a Pluto bug.

Can you open an issue on the Pluto.jl repository that explains this bug? Feel free to CC me.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]

body:
- Registering package: TcpControl
- Repository: https://github.com/wiseac/TcpControl.jl
- Created by: @wiseac
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: 57fc5e92d3eb6b51e4d91cef77e90c4fe883b556
- Git reference: HEAD
- Description: (Unofficial) This package can be used to control TCP devices through SCPI. This is a forked directory and mainly for just bug testing / personal TCP instrument code. All credit goes to the original creators (https://github.com/Orchard-Ultrasound-Innovation/TcpInstruments.jl).
title: New package: TcpControl v0.1.0
